page.title: 09INDUSTRY WOODCHESTER STROUD
page.content: {PIANO FACTORY WOODCHESTER}.The Stroud valleys are the site of some of the oldest cloth mills in Britain. At Woodchester,2 miles from Stroud, a piano factory now occupies the site of one of these mills.George 2nd is said to have visited the mill in the 18th century.Today the factory is responsible for producing 3,300 pianos annually. All the processes involved in piano manufacture,from seasoning, veneering and sanding the wood, stringing keyboards on frame casting,to the final fine-tuning,take place under one roof.Piano manufacture started here in 1911 and the company originally shared the building with an egg incubation works.There was an initial prosperous period before the factory suffered a fire in 1938.Now recovered,exports make up over half the production.
